sub: POLITICO's Morning Defense, presented by BAE Systems: House defense spending bill boosts procurement â€” SASC begins full NDAA markup â€” A very belated Hagel FOIA delivery
body: by jeremy herb am edtwith louis nelson austin wright connor o brien and ellen mitchelldriving the day congress negotiates defense bills behind closed doors the senate armed services committee and house defense appropriations subcommittee take their debates of the annual defense policy and spending bills behind closed doors the senate panel begins work on the national defense authorization act likely to stretch into thursday or friday while the house subcommittee should have a fairly quick markup at p m ahead of full committee consideration which will be open here s a look at both bills house defense spending bill boost procurement blocks army cuts the house defense spending bill released tuesday evening includes an additional billion from the war budget moved to cover base pentagon programs echoing a similar move by the house armed services committee with the extra money the bill boosts procurement funding by billion including an additional f fighters and f a super hornets as well as a third littoral combat ship the spending measure also reverses the army s planned end strength cuts and funds a full percent military pay raise the full bill is here and a summary is here the measure s funding tables will be released ahead of the full appropriations committee markup democrats slam funding gimmick in a sign of the looming defense spending fight house appropriations ranking democrat nita lowey of new york issued a statement tuesday slamming the bill s funding maneuver as a gimmick and astoundingly irresponsible by shifting funding away from overseas contingency operations the majority would create a cliff just a few months into forcing the new president to request supplemental funds to pay our troops within weeks after taking office she said in a statement sasc defense policy bill bans brac includes lower pay raise the six sasc subcommittees approved their portions of the ndaa monday and tuesday with three of them holding open sessions that teased out a few details of the full senate bill the bill would ban a new round of base closures requested by the pentagon for the fifth straight year said sen kelly ayotte r n h the readiness chairwoman i do not want to give the department the open ended authority to pursue another brac round that will incur significant up front costs ayotte said personnel subcommittee chairman lindsey graham r s c said the bill includes a lower than projected pay raise of percent rather than percent approved by the house he also added that the bill includes provisions overhauling the military s health care system aimed at sustainability higher quality better access and expand the services and the changes he suggested could be opposed by veterans and military service organizations bill likely to require women to register for the draft the senate armed services version of the defense policy bill is likely to include a provision requiring women to register for the draft i believe it will be in the mark sen claire mccaskill d mo told morning d tuesday the defense bill mark from senate armed services chairman john mccain r ariz has not yet been made public but if the provision remains after the committee completes its markup it would follow the house armed services committee where the requirement was added in as an amendment although there are efforts to remove it on the house floor senate appropriations not far behind our budget and appropriations colleagues report that senate majority leader mitch mcconnell said tuesday the defense authorization and appropriations measures are in the senate floor queue the kentucky republican said they re both likely to be considered after the senate finishes the energy and water appropriations bill and then the transportation hud and military construction va bill which will be coupled together happy wednesday and welcome to morning defense where the coffee is already flowing and we re not yet halfway through the week we re hearing sasc can get done by thursday evening at least keep the tips pitches and feedback coming at jherb politico com and follow on twitter jeremyherb morningdefense and politicopro happening today hearing on foreign military sales the defense industry s two leading trade groups testify this morning in the house armed services oversight and investigations subcommittee tom davis of the aerospace industries association and remy nathan of the national defense industrial association will discuss the pentagon s policies on foreign military sales also today carter in silicon valley defense secretary ash carter addresses a meeting of the national security telecommunications advisory committee in california and in washington rep jim bridenstine r okla discusses the security implications of rapid access to space at a forum hosted by the heritage foundation and the air force air university from the archives hagel blasts dumb black berets decision on the day chuck hagel was nominated for defense secretary we submitted a freedom of information act request for his communications with the pentagon from to during his time as a republican senator from nebraska we were hoping these letters would shed some light on his views on key issues of the past decade on tuesday three and a half years later we got a large envelope in the mail with a stack of letters from hagel to then defense secretaries donald rumsfeld and robert gates given that hagel has now been out of the government for more than a year the letters no longer have much news value except as evidence of the pentagon s less than punctual foia system but there are a few gems worth noting in hagel sent gates a letter recommending his former senate aide eric rosenbach to be deputy undersecretary of defense for intelligence rosenbach didn t get the job but he s done pretty well for himself nonetheless serving in several top pentagon posts including now as carter s chief of staff hagel also sent several letters asking about iraq war issues and he twice wrote rumsfeld to urge funding to repair a runway at offutt air force base back home in nebraska in hagel sent rumsfeld a pretty direct handwritten note complaining about then army chief of staff eric shinseki s decision to make black berets a part of the army combat uniform a move that was unpopular among soldiers and has since been reversed dear don hagel wrote i hope you personally are taking a look at this dumb black beret decision made by general shinseki i expressed my displeasure with this silly decision to cohen and shinseki one dumb decision after the other over there first black berets then the army of one slogan what the hell is next i sent the president a note on this yesterday thanks friend signed an old army sergeant chuck a message from bae systems at bae systems our experts have developed a low cost gun launched guided projectile increasing range accuracy and efficiency for our military services learn more at www baesystems com sas the capitol hill space wars how ula won round in the ndaa we dove into the backstory of the hasc amendment battle the house intelligence chairman was off the grid as the house armed services committee considered hundreds of amendments to the national defense authorization act rep duncan hunter wanted to add one more seeking to fight back against supporters of united launch alliance and their efforts to secure more russian made rocket engines there was just one problem the congressman needed fellow california republican rep devin nunes and the intelligence committee to sign off on a waiver and nunes wasn t around the waiver for hunter a spacex backer never came that night his hands were largely tied as the committee adopted an amendment from rep mike coffman r colo allowing ula to obtain russian made rd rocket engines for its military launches according to sources familiar with the daylong negotiations among lawmakers congressional aides and lobbyists from the two companies the amendment skirmish during last month s house markup was only the opening salvo in this year s space wars on capitol hill for your radar obama to visit hiroshima via the associated press eager to heal old wounds and galvanize new generations president barack obama this month will become the first sitting american president to visit hiroshima where seven decades ago the u s dropped the devastating atomic bomb that ushered in the nuclear age by visiting the peace park near the epicenter of the attack the president hopes to reinvigorate efforts worldwide to eliminate nuclear weapons but in a sign of the extraordinary political sensitivities attached to the gesture the white house is going out of its way to stress obama will not come bearing an apology slideshow what the president will see when he visits hiroshima the south china sea dispute china scrambles fighters after u s sails warship writes reuters china scrambled fighter jets on tuesday as a u s navy ship sailed close to a disputed reef in the south china sea a patrol china denounced as an illegal threat to peace which only went to show its defense installations in the area were necessary china s defense ministry said two fighter jets were scrambled and three warships shadowed the u s ship telling it to leave industry intel kendall seeks quicker program starts the pentagon s top weapons buyer on tuesday said he asked the house armed services committee to insert a provision into the committee s defense bill that would allow programs to start ahead of a budget cycle should they be urgently needed to keep pace with new threats i m thinking about a surprise where if a threat shows up on the battlefield we need to start right away with the countermeasure frank kendall said but the house armed services committee did not include the provision in the defense policy bill according to a congressional staff member speed read dozens of people are killed by a car bomb in a shiite neighborhood in baghdad ap at least people are dead in a suicide bombing in afghanistan in front of a pro government militia commander s residence reuters u s and afghan commandos rescue the son of a former pakistani prime minister in afghanistan the washington post iran announces the delivery of an s air defense missile system from russia part of a deal that was halted by complaints from the u s and russia the washington post the citadel military college in south carolina denies a request from a female muslim student to wear a headscarf ap ben rhodes and the tough sell of the president s foreign policy politico magazine classified information was inadvertently disclosed at a february guantanamo military commission hearing politico the navy tells lockheed martin to correct quality control failures in its version of the littoral combat ship bloomberg boeing s billion stock buybacks over the past three years have analysts worried the company is borrowing from the future the wall street journal the islamic state distributes lengthy kill lists of ordinary americans raising questions over whether the lists are a legitimate threat or scare tactics wsj a new fifth generation military drone being developed as a target for training missions could become a wingman for f and f fighters the daily beast a syrian national was extradited to the u s on charges of helping hack and extort american targets viewed as enemies of syrian president bashar assad ap the air force will announce the name of the new b bomber during the air force association s conference in september defense news a message from bae systems at bae systems we work relentlessly to stay ahead of any challenge our customers may face our passion and dedication shows in everything we do from advanced electronic systems to cyber operations and intelligence analysis from combat vehicles and naval weapons and from ship maintenance and modernization to vehicle upgrades and services knowing that our work makes a difference inspires us to push ourselves and the technologies we create to new levels that s bae systems that s inspired work learn more about our technologies systems and services at www baesystems com us to view online

sub: This Week on the Campaign Trail
body: it s been a disastrous week for the gop now that ted cruz and john kasich have both dropped out of the race donald trump is the republican party problems for republicans extend far beyond the cleveland convention which many top gop leaders have already vowed to avoid with trump as their nominee any remaining hope republicans had of concealing their true colors is gone party leaders shouldn t be surprised though this was a crisis of their own making for years the republican party has elevated extreme voices using divisive campaigns that sought to exploit unfounded fears for political gain now they re stuck with the most reckless dangerous and divisive nominee in modern history in every primary contest republican voters continue to report in exit polls that their primary has been divisive in some cases more than half report they feel betrayed by their own party meanwhile in poll after poll democratic voters are reporting that our primary has energized the party and that they re enthusiastic about our candidates it s clear that the enthusiasm gap favors democrats from now until election day in november democrats will hold trump accountable for his offensive rhetoric and dangerous ideas we re fighting for the american people and for the values of inclusion hard work dignity and opportunity for all looking to our convention in philadelphia we will not only emerge united but we will nominate the next president of the united states supreme court vacancythe campaign trailtrump has failed to offer any policies that would grow jobs raise wages or help american families build a better life no wonder so many republicans are running from endorsing their standard bearer will banning an entire religion help to boost your paycheck will taking healthcare away from million americans make your family more secure will building a wall with mexico help reduce your student debt republicans do not have the answers important pollswhat people are writing in the states

i just sent this to state parties thanks shu for flaggingimportance highhey everybody heads up someone named madeleine morgenstern with the washington examiner a right wing rag based in dc has been emailing the dnc and state parties asking for a list of delegates and their personal contact information we do not provide personal information or contact information about delegates especially not to right wing media outlets we would advise you to ignore this inquiry i ve included a copy of the email that was forwarded to us from one of the state parties thank you erichi xxx this is madeleine morgenstern at the washington examiner magazine we re in the early planning stages for the souvenir issue we ll be handing out at the convention in july among other things we ll be publishing the names and email addresses of all the delegates in the magazine not only will it be a keepsake of their time there it ll allow them to reach out to each other during the week i m trying to find out who i specifically need to talk to for this information from the xxxx democrats and when i should be requesting that info if i can help or answer any questions feel free to write back or call me at lt tel gt thank you madeleine morgensterndigital editor the washington examinereric walkerwalkere dnc org lt mailto walkere dnc org gt we should definitely flag for state parties good idea i don t think this is new my understanding is that it happens every convention year we ve flagged these requests for the convention team early on so brian is aware as well julieplease excuse the typos sent from my iphonei can send an alert to the state parties not to respond to this inquiry examiner is a right wing ragadding julie greene who manages the delegate certification processok this is sketchy anyone else seen this washington examiner request from other state parties i m sure you guys have seen these forwarded message date tuesday may hi leigh i m just circling back on this the washington examiner is assembling a list of names and emails of all of the delegates who will be at the dnc who should i connect with to get the connecticut democrats information thanks madeleine morgensternhi leigh this is madeleine morgenstern at the washington examiner magazine we re in the early planning stages for the souvenir issue we ll be handing out at the convention in july among other things we ll be publishing the names and email addresses of all the delegates in the magazine not only will it be a keepsake of their time there it ll allow them to reach out to each other during the week i m trying to find out who i specifically need to talk to for this information from the connecticut democrats and when i should be requesting that info if i can help or answer any questions feel free to write back or call me at lt tel gt thank you madeleine morgensterndigital editor the washington examiner madeleine morgensterndigital editor the washington examiner leigh applebycommunications sub: POLITICO's Morning Money: Welcome to jobs day â€” Clinton looks to poach GOP donors â€” Intense battle for Wall Street cash â€” Goldman hedged again
body: by ben white am edtwelcome to jobs day the april jobs report could dip below k but it s not expected to be a disaster and wages could rise a bit faster moody s mark zandi i expect payroll employment to increase by in april unemployment to decline to percent and average hourly earnings to increase by percent the expected april job gain is a bit on the soft side reflecting the weak adp data for the month the adp data overstates any weakness in the month due to a technical issue but it is still signaling that hiring slowed a bit abstracting from the monthly vagaries of the data the job market remains very strong job growth has averaged well over per month for almost years the job market is enjoying the longest streak of consecutive monthly job gains on record the only blemish are layoffs in the energy industry and trade sensitive manufacturing pantheon s ian shepherdson barring some sort of out of the blue shock we are much more interested in the hourly earnings data today than the headline payroll number the key question is the extent to which wages rebound after being depressed by a persistent calendar quirk in both february and march we think a percent increase is required to return the level of hourly earnings to trend marginally above the consensus forecast percent clinton looks to poach gop donors politico s ben white with ken vogel annie karni isaac arnsdorf and eli stokols hillary clinton s supporters in recent days have been making a furious round of calls to top bush family donors to try to convince them that she represents their values better than donald trump multiple sources in both parties told politico the moves come as clinton and the democratic party try to take advantage of deep unease among establishment republicans on wall street and elsewhere with trump s emergence as the presumptive republican nominee top targets for the clinton team include people like woody johnson jeb bush s former finance chair and the owner of the new york jets one person close to clinton said supporters of the former secretary of state drew up a list of wall street donors who supported jeb bush and other unsuccessful republican candidates months ago but wanted to wait until trump locked down the nomination before beginning to make the calls intense battle for wall street cash the race for wall street cash will be intense trump said this week that while he would help fund a general election campaign that could cost well over billion for each candidate he will also seek donations on thursday trump named steven mnuchin head of private investment firm dune capital management and a former partner at goldman sachs as his national finance chairman mnuchin himself has donated to clinton in the past highlighting the politically ambidextrous nature of many wall street donors but mnuchin s hiring could open wall street doors for trump that might otherwise be closed making the clinton effort event more important two major bush donors who received calls from clinton supporters said they would not switch their allegiance to the likely democratic nominee despite misgivings about trump s ability to win and his rhetoric on trade immigration and government spending but both suggested it was a smart play for clinton supporters to try and peel off establishment republicans who might otherwise grudgingly support trump goldman hedged again goldman sachs now has a former partner high up in the clinton campaign gary gensler and the trump campaign mnuchin mnuchin s hiring should theoretically make it very hard for trump to slam clinton s ties to wall street but like everything with trump he will do it anyway and probably get away with it why ryan scorned trump politico s jake sugar mag sherman for the past four months as trump soared in the polls ryan has watched warily a ban on muslims in the u s that s not what this country is about he said a hesitance to disavow white supremacists really trump even blasted free trade agreements pacts that ryan strongly supports but after repeating the standard line for months that he would support the party s nominee the country s highest ranking republican could not bring himself to do so once trump actually became that person good friday morning happy weekend everyone and happy early mother s day to all including m m mom ann white email me on bwhite politico com and follow me on twitter morningmoneyben driving the day jobs report at a m expected to show a gain of k unemployment to drop to percent and wages to rise by percent at p m president obama participates in a conference call briefing with small business leaders on key economic initiatives including international trade agreements affect their businesses this morning on politico pro financial services zachary warmbrodt on credit suisse and the volcker rule and to get morning money every day before a m please contact pro services at info politicopro comtrump on yellen on cnbc s squawk box when her time is up i would most likely replace her because of the fact that i think it would be appropriate she is a low interest rate person she has always been a low interest rate person and i must be honest i am a low interest rate person if we raise interest rates and if the dollar starts getting too strong we re going to have some very major problems so let me understand yellen is a low interest rate person trump is a low interest rate person but he would replace her because she is a low interest rate person got it trump on dodd frank dodd frank has to be has to be either eliminated or changed greatly i will tell you i have so many friends who are very good business people and it s impossible for them to do business with the banks the regulators are running the banks and you know you ll have bankers that get big salaries and that are very capable and all of that but they re not running the banks the regulators are running the banks fbi interview top clinton aides politico s josh gerstein top aides to democratic presidential candidate hillary clinton have been interviewed by the fbi as part of an ongoing investigation into clinton s use of a private e mail server when she was secretary of state cnn reported thursday among the aides who have spoken with the fbi is huma abedin who serves as vice chair of clinton s presidential campaign and was deputy chief of staff to clinton at the state department the network said gm lyft to test self driving cabs wsj s mike ramsey and gautham nagesh general motors co and lyft inc within a year will begin testing a fleet of self driving chevrolet bolt electric taxis on public roads a move central to the companies joint efforts to challenge silicon valley giants in the battle to reshape the auto industry the plan is being hatched a few months after gm invested million in lyft a ride hailing company whose services rival uber the program will rely on technology being acquired as part of gm s separate billion planned purchase of san francisco based cruise automation inc a developer of autonomous driving technology details of the autonomous taxi testing program are still being worked out according to a lyft executive but it will include customers in a yet to be disclosed city customers will have the opportunity to opt in or out of the pilot when hailing a lyft car from the company s mobile app in addition to driverless cars gm aims to use lyft and its growing army of drivers as a primary customer for the bolt an electric car that launches later this year amid soft demand for electric vehicles treasury cracks down on dirty money ft s barney jopson the us has launched a fresh crackdown on illicit money with new measures intended to stop tax evaders money launderers and terrorists from concealing their identities in the us financial system thursday s moves mark the latest tightening of us rules on financial governance and come less than a month after the leak of the so called panama papers wally adeyemo us deputy national security adviser for international economics told reporters fundamentally our financial system should not provide the rich the powerful and the corrupt with the opportunity to shield their assets and avoid paying their fair share obama to fall short on manufacturing goals wp s jacob bogage during president obama s reelection campaign he told voters that manufacturing jobs would be a crucial part of the american economy s resurgence his administration set a goal to create million new manufacturing jobs by the end of at the time manufacturing insiders cheered the national unemployment rate had fallen percentage points from its high point in the u s economy had added million jobs since on its way to adding million to date also for your radar pritzker on tolerance commerce secretary penny pritzker s medium post on holocaust remembrance day freedom of speech gives us the right to speak our mind it is a precious right but it does not free us from responsibility for the consequences of our words this right should not be used to dehumanize others with language bankers slam cfpb on lawsuits wsj s yuka hayashi annamaria andriotis and christina rexrode consumers are set to gain new powers to sue banks under a proposal unveiled by regulators a move that lenders warned would hurt rather than help most borrowers the plan which would allow class action lawsuits sets up the latest clash between the banking industry and the cfpb over whether the agency is coming down too hard on lenders and overly restricting their operations world leaders freaked by trump nyt s david e sanger and jim yardley alarmed by donald j trump s grip on the republican presidential nomination world leaders are wrestling with the possibility that even if he loses the general election his ascent reflects a strain of american public opinion that could profoundly reshape the way the united states addresses security alliances and trade to view online

sub: Re: Join President Obama for a discussion on May 18th
body: he s looking into it so i doubt he takes us up on it but who knowsalexandra shapiro lt tel gt dnc mid atlantic amp pac finance directorsounds like a good deal i d call and just explain that we can t accept money for potus events during a primary jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt that s my gut too like he likely already went to an hvf event on that so i d want new stuff could i try to strike a deal with him and push for k or k so he feels like he s getting a discount for his past support i ll pitch him on doing a second max out to get the main line package i just don t know him and am worried about striking out if he won t do the fullwhat do you think ok to do deals on this one alexandra shapiro lt tel gt dnc mid atlantic amp pac finance directori don t think so what do you think jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt we re not accepting hvf for this right alexandra shapiro lt tel gt dnc mid atlantic amp pac finance director forwarded message date tue may at pm he did his max out to hfv are you okay with it thanks karina iâ ve already done i assume iâ m maxed out best regards johnjohn a braunpresident amp chairmandynamis inc willow oaks corporate drivesuite fairfax va p f c jbraun dynamis com lt mailto jbraun dynamis com gt democrats friend we re excited to announce that president obama will be joining us for a lively discussion in washington dc on wednesday may th there is so much at stake in this election and we hope you will use this event as an opportunity to put your support behind the dnc donald trump and all of the backwards offensive outrageous ideas that come with him is the gop s presumptive presidential nominee a trump presidency would reverse all that we have worked to accomplish during president obama s administration obamacare marriage equality and our economic growth would all be threatened by such a volatile leader and we cannot allow his messages of fear and hatred to take over our country there are just days until the philadelphia convention and days until the general election help us ensure that we have the resources needed to help democrats win we need your help to make sure donald trump is not elected the next president of the united states this november with questions or for more information please contact karina marquez at marquezk dnc org lt mailto marquezk dnc org gt or we look forward to seeing you on may th best your mid atlantic finance teamalex shapiro andrew wright and karina marquezpaid for by the democratic national committee south capitol street se washington dc and not authorized by any candidate or candidate s committee contributions or gifts to the democratic national committee are not tax deductible

thoughts jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt begin forwarded message date may at pm edthi luisi m adding jordan to see if there has been any fundraising ask to them so far luis if spicer is doing for rnc seems like you might be best rep i leave it to you guys to see if opportunity for ussent from my iphonehi amy wanted to forward this along to you to see what you thought about who should speak to this crowd might be a good group to make a contribution ask perhaps democratic national committeehey luis following up on our conversation below is the event i was telling you about date wednesday june thtime p m each speaker speaks for minutes â speakers sean spicer from the rnc is speakinglocation hyatt regency crystal citywhat the national franchisee association nfa is that national trade association representing burger kingâ franchisees in the united states and canada who operate more than small businesses and employ almost individuals across north america for the last eleven years nfa and burger king corporation have jointly held our annual summit in washington d c which brings together approximately burger kingâ franchise operators suppliers and vendors as well as many bkc corporate executives for two days of business and legislative briefings as well as hill visits as part of our legislative workshop we would like a representative from the dnc to speak to our attendees about the current democratic presidential candidates the outlook for the convention and general election and how those candidates will help small business owners like those in attendance note that a representative from the rnc will be speaking on the same topics as well is this something you can do thanks patrice

sub: BREAKING NEWS: Hillary Clinton wins Connecticut Democratic primary
body: hillary clinton has won the connecticut democratic primary according to the associated press clinton campaigned hard on the message of gun safety in connecticut a little more than three years after the massacre at sandy hook elementary school in newtown at various panels featuring the family members of gun violence victims in connecticut and elsewhere clinton and her surrogates sought to draw distinctions between the positions and past votes of the democratic frontrunner and bernie sanders connecticut gov dannel malloy backed clinton s bid along with the state s attorney general and lieutenant governor and a host of mayors from across the state both of the state s u s senators richard blumenthal and chris murphy also threw their support behind clinton connecticut allocates its pledged delegates on a proportional basis

here are a couple options forwarded message date mon aug at pmmatt labor day is almost here but there s one quick matter of business before we get ready to enjoy the long weekend our end of month deadline is hours away and it s pretty damn important we still need a few more supporters to start a monthly donation of or more before midnight if we want to meet our goal will you be one of them here s what we have on record for this email address name mattemail mattcomp gmail com lt mailto mattcomp gmail com gt donations number of donations this time next year we want to be able to stand behind our nominee with the strongest support possible the money we raise now has a huge impact on what we can bring to the table to help elect democrats up and down the ballot in that s why i have to ask will you step up matt thanks so much we seriously couldn t do it without you have a great labor day jordanjordan kaplanfinance directordemocratic national committeep s if you donate by tonight s deadline you ll be automatically entered to win a chance to meet president obama in new york city next month how can you turn that down forwarded message date fri sep at pm democrats matt ok picture this you your best friend president obama first lady michelle obama vice president joe biden and secretary hillary clinton all in the same place i want to make that happen so we ll send a lucky winner to an event with all four of them and put you and your friend up in a nice hotel in d c i m telling you all this because i really do want you to have this chance and it s worth mentioning as a staff member here at dnc hq i m not eligible to win just pitch in or whatever you can to be automatically entered you re one of our most committed supporters because you ve saved your payment information your donation will go through immediately or donate another amount good luck matt jordanjordan kaplanfinance directordemocratic national committee forwarded message date sat nov at pm democrats join us matt i love this time of year when i get to kick back with my family and watch some late november football do a little bit of bargain shopping and make as many meals as possible with all of the leftover turkey in our fridge seriously there s way too much but in the midst of all the hoopla and holiday cheer i ve had this in the back of my mind by next thanksgiving we will have already elected the next president of the united states to borrow a metaphor from the official sport of the thanksgiving season we need every player on the field and every head in our team s huddle to win in so if you re ready to show your democratic pride and help democrats keep the white house and take back congress then pitch in or more before our end of month deadline and we ll make sure you re one of the very first supporters to receive our official membership card you re one of our most committed supporters because you ve saved your payment information your donation will go through immediately or donate another amount like inches on a football field matt every dollar counts during an election season so thanks for stepping up today i ll be in touch again soon jordanjordan kaplanfinance directordemocratic national committeedate wednesday april at pmsmall favor can you send me an old fundraising email i sent thanks jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt cid bcd e e b a a b

sub: POLITICO's 2016 Blast: Bernâ€™s 'messy' day  â€” The Trump-RNC fundraising apparatus â€” Rubioâ€™s relives his robot moment â€” 5 things you need to know
body: by henry c jackson pm edtuncontrolled bern it seems we will bern until the end happy tuesday there s no walking this back it s your blast henry c jackson henrycjjackson is here to guide you through the day s campaign news so send your tips complaints and favorite s things more on that in a second to hjackson politico com a narcissist and two months later leading a super pac designed to get him elected blast note here s a shortlist of some things we miss from the s starter jackets larry johnson grandmama commercials fresh prince of bel air the phrase as if snap bracelets robot reconsidered in an interview with the guardian marco rubio comes to grips with a moment that many feel was an inflection point for his campaign the seemingly robotic repeat response to chris christie s badgering during a gop debate in new hampshire but rubio said that while he could have handled the situation differently and perhaps should have he didn t think it swayed voters just drove media coverage but thanks media rubio also seems to think coverage changed things a bit i do think it impacted media coverage in the days leading up to the new hampshire vote which i think ultimately hurt us rubio said i think we would have finished very strongly in newtrail mix elsewhere on the campaign trail no more debates no more debates no more debates until the fall bernie sanders wishes there were more donald trump has many conspiracy theories neil young has no problem and the fbi investigation of terry mcauliffe is another unwelcome fbi investigation for hillary clinton what s next california hillary clinton has an event in salinas calif bernie sanders continues to campaign in the state the joint rnc donald trump committee has its first fundraiser in the los angeles area magic number follow politico s politics team politicocharlie politico steve politicoalex anniekarni glennthrush elistokols katieglueck schreckreports gdebenedetti hadas gold ec schneider kyledcheney theodoricmeyer marcacaputo politicokevin mikeallen dlippman danielstrauss henrycjjackson shanegoldmacher kristinpolitico politicoscott patrick c reisto view online

sub: POLITICO Breaking News: Trump and Ryan call meeting 'step toward unification'
body: presumptive republican presidential nominee donald trump and house speaker paul ryan issued a joint statement after their thursday morning meeting on capitol hill calling the session a very positive step toward unification the statement read as follows the united states cannot afford another four years of the obama white house which is what hillary clinton represents that is why it s critical that republicans unite around our shared principles advance a conservative agenda and do all we can to win this fall trump and ryan said with that focus we had a great conversation this morning while we were honest about our few differences we recognize that there are also many important areas of common ground we will be having additional discussions but remain confident there s a great opportunity to unify our party and win this fall and we are totally committed to working together to achieve that goal we are extremely proud of the fact that many millions of new voters have entered the primary system far more than ever before in the republican party s history this was our first meeting but it was a very positive step toward unification

sub: RE: Ohio Golden Week/Online Voter Reg
body: in more news from ohio the legislature today passed online voter registration like florida it will not become effective until ohio has allowed citizens to update their voter registration online for several years and that function will continued to be offered leading up to the november election in the lawsuit brought by odp and others a federal district court has held that the ohio legislature s elimination of golden week violates both the th amendment of the constitution and section of the voting rights act this is a big win perkins the campaigns and our team are still reviewing the decision pratt norton wileynational director of voter expansiondemocratic national committeew m wileyp dnc org lt mailto wileyp dnc org gt prattwiley footer d

great i ll look forward to seeing a new one by noon on monday jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt sorry i m out of town this weekend can we talk by phone monday to go over strategy and all the rest zachary allen sent from my iphonejordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt guys this isn t a weekly this is a call log it has nothing about robbie kaplan it has no other surrogate doesn t discuss event strategy how are you up selling the th itjordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt have a nice weekend zachary allendemocratic national committeefinance director new york tri state direct allenz dnc org lt mailto allenz dnc org gt lt memo may docx gt

sub: The Daily 202: The Democratic Establishment strikes back in the Acela Primary
body: the daily from powerposthillary is now the presumptive democratic nominee after a five state sweep donald trump will be almost impossible to beat if he wins indiana â â if you re having trouble reading this â click here lt view url gt hillary clinton celebrates her big wins with supporters at the philadelphia convention center last night photo by melina mara the washington post the big idea â democratic insiders in d c got everything they were rooting for along the i corridor last night in maryland rep chris van hollen defeated rep donna edwards in the democratic primary to succeed retiring sen barbara mikulski he had the support of the stateâ s political establishment including martin oâ malley and the donor class donald trump speaks last night at trump tower â ricky carioti the washington post most of all though national democrats took heart in trumpâ s clean sweep they badly want to face the billionaire in the fall confident that his unpopularity would allow them to win the senate and hold the white house tuesday can only be described as another debacle for the stop trump movement cnn s tally the coverage this morning makes clear that bernieâ s hopes are dashed bernie sanders speaks yesterdayâ at the big sandy superstore arenaâ in huntington west virginia photo by john sommers ii getty images whatâ s next â sanders has pledged to remain in the race but in a statement tuesday night he suggested motives besides winning the nomination such as shaping the democratic partyâ s platform would keep him in the campaign â bernie beat reporter john wagner reports in west virginia earlier in the day bernie listed several issues he would like to see addressed in philadelphia including a minimum wage and support for a single payer health care system cruz speaks to supporters in knightstown indiana â reuters aaron p bernstein the texas senatorâ s very real problem is that anti trump voters are not rallying behind him as the best alternative not that maryland will be competitive in the fall but percent of maryland republicans said they would definitely vote for trump if he became the partyâ s nominee compared to only percent who said theyâ d definitely back cruz even missouri sen claire mccaskill d mocked his chances trump on clinton the only card she has is the woman s card â i think the only card she has is the womanâ s card sheâ s got nothing else going on â he said at trump tower â the only thing sheâ s got going on is the womenâ s vote and the beautiful thing is women donâ t like her ok â earlier in the day he boasted about actress lena dunham saying sheâ ll move to canada if heâ s elected â sheâ s a b actor and has no you know mojo â he said still don t think trump is toxic for republicans in a general election if heâ s the nominee every single gop candidate in a top tier race will be attacked over the aforementioned comments do you agree hillary would only get percent of the vote if she was a man they might be able to duck that question right now but their opponents wonâ t allow that come fall they will either distance themselvesâ and risk alienating trump supportersâ or stay silent and then get forced to own it remember trump also brags about never changing diapers he said megyn kelly had blood coming out of her wherever when she questioned him about his history of calling women disgusting animals and dogs bottom line it will just be so so so easy for democrats to portray trump as unconcerned with the daily struggles of women â as trump put it last night â i donâ t want to change my personality it got me here â other gems from his victory lap secondary storylines out of last nightâ chaka fattah with his wife renee concedes last night at the headquarters of the national union of hospital and health care employees â steven m falk the philadelphia inquirer via ap bill shusterâ ap photo keith srakocic chris van hollen celebrates his win at the bethesda marriott last night photo by katherine frey the washington post what our exit polling tells us about how van hollen won â although edwards polled stronger with women leading into the election she lost women voters percent to van hollen â explains post pollster scott clement â perhaps surprisingly edwards received a narrow percent majority support among black women compared with percent support among black men â donna edwards concedes at the international brotherhood of electrical workers local union in lanham last night â photo by marvin joseph the washington post catherine pughâ talks to a television reporter after having lunch at belvedere square photo by barbara haddock taylor baltimore sun welcome to the daily powerpost s morning newsletter while you were sleeping get smart fast â â the daily donald â trumpâ senior adviser paul manafort l arrives with ben carson for a reception at the republican national committee spring meeting in florida last week reuters joe skipper in one deal records show manafort borrowed and later repaid a loan from a middle eastern arms dealer at the center of a french inquiry into whether kickbacks were paid to politicians in a presidential campaign in another a russian businessman accused manafort of taking nearly million intended for investments then failing to account for funds or respond to inquiries about how they were used attorneys for the businessman claimed at one point they could not locate manafort or his partner and hired a private investigator to track them down â prior to joining trumpâ s campaign manafort had operated largely out of the limelight but he once explained his approach to business during public testimony to congress â the technical term for what we do is â lobbying â manafort said â for the â purposes of today i will admit that in a narrow sense some people might term it â influence peddling â â in texas cruz is positioned to sweep the stateâ s enormous delegate haul â iâ d be very surprised if out of the werenâ t for cruz â said steve munisteri a former state party chairman who is unaligned â in missouri â a state trump narrowly won â cruz is poised to dominate local and state level contests for delegates â in iowa a slate of statewide delegates will include at least cruz backers including rep steve king bob vander plaats and cruz staffer bryan english and the others â arenâ t exactly trump loyalists â in illinois kasich supporters are most likely to dominate the statewide delegate slots even though theyâ ll be pledged to trump on a first ballot â in virginia which holds its state convention this weekend â at least one state gop central committee member noted that cruz supporters are expected to dominate â and will be able to have their way with the delegate slate candidates for delegate slots include ken cuccinelli the former virginia attorney general who is one of cruzâ s top delegate organizers â more on the republican race ap photo aj mast gt indiana governor mike pence reacts last month to news thatâ carrier was closing a worker plant in indy and a worker factory in huntington â ap photo aj mast mitch mcconnell listens as john cornynâ speaks to reporters at the capitol â ap photo manuel balce ceneta more on the democratic race flanked by steelworkers hillary speaks on her plans for the economy in hammond indiana â epa tannen maury the clinton campaign isâ retoolingâ its messagingâ on trade â speaking to an audience of steel employees and their families in hammond yesterday clinton promised to make â survivalâ of the industry one of her top priorities â iâ m saying to ceos who think they can make a quick buck by turning their back on our country we are not going to let you take advantage of us anymore â clinton said â iâ m going to stand up to both ceos at home and china abroad â theâ democratic front runner alsoâ delivered some thinly veiled digs at sanders â itâ s not enough just to diagnose the problem â clinton said â we all know that we are losing jobs we all know that we are facing unfair competition â give me the specifics donâ t just give me the rhetoric and the demagoguery â wapo highlight hamdullah mohib in his office at the embassy of afghanistanâ photo by bill o leary the washington post social media speed read â zignal visual trump calling for sanders to run as a third party candidate has about retweets our analytics partners at zignal labs are amazed at trumpâ s ability to control his own social media message very consistently the most popular tweets about trump come from the candidate himself clinton also drove her own social media message yesterday the top five tweets about her were from the official hillaryclinton account but they got just a fraction of the retweets and favorites that trumpâ s did chris christie and his wife mary pat were standing behind trump as he spoke many on the internet believed they could see new jersey s first ladyâ rolling her eyes as trump talked about how hillary would only be gettingâ percent of the vote if she was a man â others thought she was remarkably stoic â either way it would have been fun to be a fly on the wall during their drive back to jerseyâ mary pat christie as trump talks woman s card here s a sampling of the twitter reaction cruz awkwardlyâ tried to recreate a scene from hoosiers â at an indiana rally cruz tries to recreate scene from hoosiers in the process he called a basketball hoop a basketball ring the dean could not handle it sanders brought up the clinton trump relationship in a fundraising email speaking of trump check out this sign from outside his forthcoming d c hotel â lots of pundits have been wrong over the past year but many decided to makeâ fun of this bill kristolâ tweet from last summer d c celebrated college signing day scott brown with a small dig at his wife joked about their dog intense weather hit the midwest house republicans got a visit from a bald eagle john mccain said he supports mixed martial artist phil davis for thanks ambassador let me find out and send a few emails around here and see what people are saying thanks jordan jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org gt gt jordan gt gt anji hunter was gordon brown s and tony blair s private secretary her husband is the main reporter for sky news any way i can help accommodate her request to get into the convention in philadelphia gt gt lou gt gt gt gt from anji hunter lt anji hunter gmail com lt mailto anji hunter gmail com gt gt gt gt date may at pm cdt gt gt gt gt dear marjorie and lou gt gt gt gt i hope this finds you both well what doings both sides of the pond our elections kick off this week will be resolved in june rumblings will continue and then it s all eyes on you guys gt gt gt gt adam is assigned to cover the conventions and we will both be in washington staying in georgetown july and just wondered if you might happen to be there then it is an off chance i know but it would be great if you were and had an evening free for a dinner with us gt gt gt gt secondly and forgive me for even asking is there any way i can get entry to the philadelphia dnc as a sister party member long time fan i will pay of course if that is an option we the labour party and please accept my apologies for their current appalling transgressions charge for guests and maybe there is a similiar arrangement anyway i would of course love to be there but also understand if there is nothing you can do and feel overwhelmed with people hassling you gt gt gt gt but hope we will catch up with you anyway are you over here at all gt gt gt gt love from us both gt gt anjix gt gt gt gt gt gt gt

body: we should re up some of these especially unfit to be commander in chief st on cnn trump former opponent rick perry tells me he will support realdonaldtrump amp do everything he can to help more on outfrontcnnrick perry said donald trumpâ s rhetoric was â damaging to our party and most important damaging to the united states of americaâ perry trump does not â represent the republican party that i represent â â perry competent well listen he doesn t reflect the republican party from my position i mean when he said what he said about immigrants in this country and used very inflammatory language when he said what he said about veterans in this country and people who have gotten captured i don t know about anybody else i ll speak for myself he didn t represent the republican party that i represent â hannity fox news rick perry has called donald trump â unfit to be commander in chiefperry said trumpâ s comments about john mccainâ s war record were past offensive to â those of us who have worn the uniform of this country â â perry but i want to go back to this issue about saying that john mccain is not a war hero and that he doesn t like to be around people who were captured that is offensive i mean it s past offensive sean to those of us who have worn the uniform of this country sam johnson who i served in the texas legislature with spent over seven years in that pow camp to offend those individuals but to offend their families and to offend those that went through this period of time it s just from my perspective donald trump does not have the character nor does he have the temperament to be the commander in chief of our military forces i m just stunned â hannity fox news

sub: Event: Trump in OR Weekend of May 7-8???
body: despite this article there are rumors swirling that he will visit the beaver state more leaks from law enforcement being approached by secret service this would be the same time he is expected to visit wa so it makes sense will donald trump try to make portland great ahead of the oregon primary the question loomsby eder campuzano the oregonian oregonliveemail the author follow on twitteron april at pmhe s got the headquarters set up but is donald trump visiting oregon ahead of the state s may primary it s tough to say reports indicate that the frontrunner for the republican presidential nomination is probably going to be in vancouver on may but the campaign has remained mum on whether or not an appearance in the beaver state is in the cards the oregonian oregonlive reached out to trump s media team tuesday but we haven t heard back in the meantime rival john kasich has scheduled a town hall meeting at castaway in portland thursday both men will vie for oregon s delegates when the primaries come up as of tuesday evening trump has of the delegates necessary to claim the republican nomination kasich has and with delegates left in the remaining contests both kasich and sen ted cruz only have one shot at blocking trump s designation as the nominee spread out and keep the donald from winning individual states until the gop convention still the question of whether trump will visit portland ahead of the state primary is up in the air oregon s delegates aren t quite the up for grabs in washington a week later or the that california has to offer on june but how does trump think he ll make america great again if he fails to visit the one city where he can snag a bacon maple bar befriend a pizza squirrel or bagpipe playing darth vader and pick up a new fireplace on the cheap all in one afternoon actually when you take all of that into consideration portland s already pretty great on its own of course the maybe billionaire could merely be biding his time fervently planning a campaign event where he gets a visit from some of the local wildlife in a bid to out do birdie sanders maybe that s what that cougar was doing in gresham last week if trump is indeed looking for an animal friend to spruce up any of his speeches we know one avian accomplice that s likely to be left off the shortlist best sean sorbietracking coordinatordemocratic national committeeoffice cell sigdems

sub: RE: The New York Times: A State Bucks the Trend on Voting Rights
body: following up on a previous email i made a change below let me know if this works does this work the first line needs to point out that below the statement there is also an article op ed whatever it is democratic national committeewanted to run this for a last time by luis and mark before i blast the democratic party applauds virginia governor terry mcauliffe s decision to restore the voting rights of over citizens terry and i first started working on voting rights together when he was the dnc chair and he helped established the voting rights institute democrats across the nation believe the right to vote is our most fundamental right it is the right that protects and preserves all of our other rights and freedoms democrats also know that we solve our nation s problems with more democracy not less the contrast between our two national parties has never been more stark than on the issue of our democracy sadly restricting access to the ballot box has become the political strategy for the republican party we have witnessed republican led legislatures in arizona north carolina ohio wisconsin and elsewhere make it harder to vote by eliminating same day registration reducing early voting eliminating polling locations and imposing strict photo id laws democrats however are actively fighting to the expanding expand voter access in states like virginia california pennsylvania west virginia and vermont and everywhere in between we are fighting in state houses to pass automatic registration implement online voter registration expand early voting and same day registration democrats in congress are working to restore the full strength of the voting rights act when long lines form or citizens are unable to overcome election burdens republicans blame the problem on too many voters and celebrate those burdens as a key to their general election victory meanwhile new york democrats are holding people accountable and actively seeking answers because republicans don t hold themselves accountable for election failures the democratic national committee and its partners are doing so for them by filing suit in arizona to reverse the culture of discrimination and disenfranchisement today s action is a reminder that elections matter our nation and our democracy are stronger and healthier when we elect democrats up and down the ticket new york times editorial boardto people who have served their time and finished parole mr mcauliffe said in a statement i want you back in society i want you feeling good about yourself i want you voting getting a job paying taxes it is the largest restoration of voting rights by a governor ever now in the absence of a strong pre emptive tool like section the only meaningful remedy to a discriminatory voting change is litigation an expensive and time consuming process that often comes too late to help voters who were harmed by new discriminatory laws congress should amend the voting rights act to restore preclearance and apply it to all jurisdictions with a recent history of discriminatory voting practices and state officials who are not busy trying to disenfranchise people should be following mr mcauliffe s example and working to make it easier for people to vote

sub: Episode 8: "Masters in Politics" Podcast with Trump Sr. Adviser & Sanders Campaign Manager
body: bloomberg politics masters in politics podcastexcerpt we are going to have a campaign unlike anything we ve ever seen before we ve got two people who both have negatives well into the s and it s not gonna be beanbag it s not going to be gentle they are both going throw everything they can and that s just the way politics is today bennett also says the dust up between house speaker paul ryan and trump is merely a hour bump by the time the two of them meet next week he says they ll be old friends and ryan will support the republican candidate for president on the democratic side sanders campaign manager jeff weaver says that while secretary clinton may want to move on bernie sanders is going to fight for every vote and every delegate from now till the end that includes he says a full court press in california over the next few weeks excerpt if secretary clinton is the nominee it s really gonna be incumbent on her to reach out to the millions of people who have supported bernie sanders who want real change who are tired of establishment politics and to address the concerns that those people have about what kind of president she would be in terms of fighting for these agenda items the secretary has obviously moved to the left of this campaign substantially in an attempt to block out senator sanders but as too often happens one worries that when the primary is over that candidate becomes much more centrist in a general election and if that happens i think you will see a lot of sanders supporters just sit home frankly you can hear much more from these two masters in politics including why bennett thinks donald trump and bill clinton have the same personality off stage and why weaver isn t yet satisfied with their representation on key dnc convention committees thanks for your support betsyepisode debbie wasserman schultz and kate andersen browerepisode reince priebus donna brazile and craig gordonepisode haley barbour and bob shrumepisode mike murphy ben ginsberg and kevin cirilliepisode tad devine and katie packerepisode joel benenson and joe mcquaidepisode jeb bush and j ann selzer this email was sent to mirandal dnc org mailto mirandal dnc org body: pmformer nj gov christie todd whitman saying she will write in instead of vote for trump say that she puts her country in front of her party etc

good morning a few hours ago the guam caucus took place and we wanted to share with you and your teams some topline information on their delegate selection process on our side there are pledged delegates up for grabs below please find a brief summary of the process attached you will find the internal fact sheet we will send around results when they are released as always please let us know if you have any questions guam caucus may the caucus begins at am chst pm est on may the caucus will be held at the agana shopping center in hagatna guam results will be announced from the guam chairman joaquin perez there are a total of pledged delegates that will be allocated proportionally based on saturday s results a percent threshold is required in order for a presidential contender to received pledged delegates at either the congressional district or statewide level the delegate breakdown is at large delegatesin addition to the pledged delegates there are unpledged delegates from guam republican processthe republican caucus took place on saturday march a territorial caucus convened as a convention to choose delegates to the republican national convention there is no formal system to relate the presidential preference of the convention participants to the choice of the delegates to the republican convention in addition party leaders the national committeeman the national committeewoman and the chairman of the guam s republican party will attend the convention as unpledged delegates by virtue of their position

getting up early and i like tweeting i like getting the message outpolls against hillary leading in rasmussen hrc has bad judgement benghazi is an example of her bad judgmentwould you have stayed out of libya i would have stayed out of iraq libyawould you have stayed out of syria i would have stayed out of syria and wouldn t have gone after assad as hard would still take out isis focus on isis not sub: RE: Video Request: Trump Morning Shows 5/4
body: admit that you re surprised with how this played out i m happy with how it played outhow do you turn around and unite the party i ve gotten lots of calls from people more brutal than ted was who want to join the team they re politicians it was just talk do you care if ted endorsed you it would be nice there are some republicans whose endorsement i don t really want don t need them i ll do great on economy and militarygeorge will conservative duty to make you lose all states he s a loser a tower guy i don t want his support says he didn t want to go to will s speech at mar a lago because will is boring and i didn t know i was going to go into politics he holds a grudge he has no influence all his columns are bad all krauthamer does is bash me i ll have the slowest trigger on nuclear but i ll prepare it dem candidate will support intervention more than gop nominee krauthammer was pushing for the war in iraq and as a civilian i was totally against it we need a strong temperament the world is laughing at us clip of hrc saying trump has given no indication that trump understands gravity of being commander in chief it s just words just another politician talking sanders said she has poor judgment he also says she was unqualified but i won t go there re emails she should suffer like others who have done far less shouldn t even be allowed to runyou ve said things that people think you will change in general muslim ban we have to be vigilant have to be very careful obama doesn t say the term so that policy is still on the table well i don t know if it hurts me i ve been guided by common sense and what s right we have to be careful we have to figure out what the hell is going on thousands and thousands of people are being placed around the country with no documentation in europe they re destroying countries with the migrations punishment for abortions he was asking a rhetorical standpoint and i gave an answer says his answer was a great academic answer says nobody thinks he supports punishing womenwallace you will need to turn democrats to you how will you turn around your negatives with married women we have tremendous numbers of democrats says lots of democrats in ny wanted to vote for trump but weren t allowed women want security our military has been decimated gen orierno sp says military is unpreparedbut women want someone steady you shoot from the hip i don t shoot from the hip in recent states i won with women in every state by massive majorities i m doing really well with the men hrc doesn t know anything about jobs her husband passed naftajoe you will have more populist republican and more interventionist democrat in this general heilman you re heading into a billion general election will you accept super pac support i m going to be making a decision over the next week we will need money for the party i don t even want some republicans support it will be hrc because system is rigged against bernie i ll have to decide if i want to sell a few buildings not sure i want to do that don t want money for myself want it for the party vp selection says the names being floated are generally right more than likely i ll go the political route o want someone who can help get legislation passed so he won t have to use eos like obamanot a general one of my strengths will be the military nathan kauffman j d sub: President Clinton to Campaign for Hillary Clinton in Montana
body: president clinton to campaign for hillary clinton in montana on friday may president bill clinton will campaign for hillary clintonin montana ahead of the june primary clinton will hold a public eventin billings where he will discuss why hillary clinton is the best candidateto raise wages and break down all the barriers holding montana familiesback media interested in covering this event should rsvp herethursday may at pm media who rsvp to the event will receive a credentialconfirmation and logistical information after the rsvp deadline hillary for montana billings organizing event when friday may at pmwhere will james middle school th st w billings montana doors open pm public rsvp here for immediate release may contact press hillaryclinton compaid for by hillary for americacontributions or gifts to hillary for america are not tax deductible hillary for america po box new york you received this message because you are subscribed to the google groups nationalpress group to unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it send an email to nationalpress unsubscribe hillaryclinton com

court nominating process is serious donald trump is not again and again he has demonstrated he lacks the experience and temperament to be an effective commander in chief so it comes as no surprise sub: RE: HuffPo: Paul Ryanâ€™s Big Plan To Replace Obamacare Is An Old Idea That Doesnâ€™t Work
body: yup this is very goodblastablepaul ryanâ s big plan to replace obamacare is an old idea that doesnâ t workit took him six years to come up with a policy invented in the s washington â if you were hoping republicans had fresh new solutions for health care reform up their sleeves you might find the recent hints from house speaker paul ryan r wis a bit disappointing the cornerstone of ryanâ s approach is so called high risk pools a form of health insurance designed for people with the most serious health conditions and highest costs who were mostly locked out of the regular private market before the affordable care act required insurers to accept all applicants â we can and should and must fix that â ryan said in response to a question from a student who said his family had benefited from obamacareâ s protections for people with pre existing conditions the problem is high risk pools â which existed in states before the affordable care act made them virtually obsolete â always failed to achieve their goal of providing a true insurer of last resort to those who needed it the biggest reason is money covering the medical costs of the sickest people in the country is very expensive and the government has never devoted the funds necessary to make this work â high risk pools are never successful in providing affordable coverage for people who otherwise had no alternative â said edwin park vice president for health policy at the center on budget and policy priorities â conceptually it doesnâ t work you can keep throwing money at it but itâ s a losing proposition over time â and these are the same promises that led to the creation of the pre obamacare high risk pools in the first place they didnâ t pan out â for years states tried to meet this challenge but never could â karen pollitz a senior fellow at the henry j kaiser family foundation told the huffington post in an email in any given year about one fifth of americans account for around four fifths of health care spending and high risk pools are designed to attract the very sickest and most expensive customers pollitz said faced with this reality the government cut back on the old high risk pools rather than spend what it would have taken to make them functional â they looked for other ways to limit costs of their state high risk pool programs â surcharging premiums imposing high deductibles and low lifetime limits and most of all excluding people based on their pre existing conditions â pollitz said â that meant the vast majority of people who were eligible for and needed high risk pool coverage couldnâ t enroll â in other words states found out that covering all these sick people cost a ton of money they werenâ t willing to spend so they scaled back the programs and cut off new enrollment ryan also indicated he wants to â open up underwriting â which in insurance jargon means allowing insurers to charge higher rates to people based on their medical histories under obamacare insurers canâ t do that they also canâ t make women pay more than men and they can only charge middle aged people up to three times the premiums paid by young adults ryanâ s proposal to â open up underwritingâ would affect people not deemed sick enough to join a high risk pool â which could mean everyone with common ailments like diabetes and asthma or a healthy person with a history of cancer or other diseases thatâ s how the insurance market worked when underwriting was permitted before the affordable care act this was part of ryanâ s argument to the college aged audience that letting insurance companies once again discriminate against the sick and moving the most ailing into a separate program would be good for them young people would pay lower health insurance premiums if older sicker people were in a separate program he said but that doesnâ t account for the cost to taxpayers of whatever government subsidies would be provided to people in the high risk pools and it ignores the reality that everyone if they live long enough goes from being the healthy person to being the sick person pollitz said earlier in his appearance at georgetown ryan repeated his promise that republicans would finally tell americans how they would do health care reform differently â what does patient centered health care look like we donâ t think the affordable care act is working â he said â news flash republicans are against obamacare but we owe it to people to show what we would replace it with we have to show what we would do differently â
if we could get the early play of the trump interview please thank you

sub: Re: Update from TP on Alaska.
body: garret has already spoken with shana before we even got off the plane we will call the assemblywoman when we get to the hotel ethan berkowitz is the new mayor of anchorage i know him he was an r b candidate in when i co chaired it he s also jewish dws gt gt just spoke to shana she s the one she said she knows all the players on both sides and she has her marching orders from the senator she already had garret s number she also said that there are more of us than there are of them and the senator has been making calls all day since he spoke to you they are delighted that you are in alaska have fun and make sure your baby girl has a great time i don t have words for your so called political shop call shana first gt gt tp gt gt gt gt gt we just landed thanks trace we will connect with everyone below gt gt gt gt dws gt gt gt gt gt gt gt gt spoke with the assemblywoman gray jackson she will be happy to meet you this evening or first thing in the morning she definitely wants to meet and talk with you but she told me that she just spoke with the mayor of anchorage and that her understanding is the the senator has assigned someone from his team shana thoma to you for the day assemblywoman gray jackson is originally from jersey she is going to events during the day but not the dinner she said she s from newark and she won t be bullied and she didn t want to have to curse anybody out but after talking to chaka she was at an event with the mayor and told him about you coming etc and he said that it was all worked out so garret here are two numbers for you gt gt gt gt gt gt assemblywoman elvi gray jackson asked that you please call her once dws lands and gets situated she would love to speak to her candidly about the events she attended today and provide some background gt gt gt gt gt gt shana thoma this is the person from the senator s team that has been assigned to staff dws her cell is gt gt gt gt gt gt i am calling shana now reviewing the speech and
