sub: Stitch Scooplet: Pro-Hillary Web Ad Hits Trump on Businesses, Calls Him 'Con Man'; Stitch Chat with Sen. Chris Coons on Foreign Policy
body: what s the stitch the stitch is a morning news speed read highlighting the work and insights ofnewsmakers it s followed by a daily chat on hot political topics today s sidewire chats stitch scooplet superpac web ad says trump s a con man priorities usa the pro clinton superpac is up with a new web ad that calls donald trump a con man in it trump talks about his success as a businessman as stamps with the words failed bankrupt and fraud flash on the screen over top of various ventures from his branded steaks to an atlantic city casino and his trump university at the end trump repeats the words believe me as the words con man appear on the screen why this mattersclinton s biggest vulnerability to trump right now is the perception that he would be better for jobs and the economy in a cnn orc poll earlier this month clinton led trump by double digits overall but he held a percent to percent lead on the economy hillary clinton doesn t have a deep background in economics and has been until this point leaning on her own platform and bill clinton s record to recommend her as a good steward of the economy if trump can convince the american public that he s a great businessman and could replicate his success in the corporate world for the rest of the country clinton is in trouble she doesn t have to beat him on the economy but it s usually the no issue so fighting him to a draw or a near draw would seem imperative sidewire chat recap x in yesterday s edition of the recurring chat x mike murphy hosted comedy writer jon macks an eight time emmy award nominee who wrote for the tonight show for years and has supplied his writing talent to a wide range of comedians and political figures jon they have a char limit on this so i can t squeeze in the whole bio but i ll add you wrote an interesting book monologue what makes america laugh before bed welcome q how does the am news turn into laughs on late night tv for me i d go to a few websites write down topics generally political then start writing by p m i d have jokes for monologue today i d of course focus on ky and oregon leno would pick or so how many guys would be on staff any ky or oregon joke pitches off the top of your head if you were writing today writers on staff joke hillary won the kentucky narrowly in honor of the event today she wore a bluegrass colored pantssuit and bernie won oregon best day for him since they invented flomax on which late night shows politicians should do my experience back when with mccain in was leno had a more meat and potatoes audience good for gop colbert is trying to be a political platform now but i d send my guy to fallon today younger hipper safe and friendly you fallon if you have no real charisma as jimmy will help you out for more back and forth conan and lately i might go corden very strong but it s not like when jay was on it s a lot lighter nowadays no chance for a message around the comedy other thing i d say is late night is a non filtered way to get a fun softer message out to larger audience and it gets covered and amplified as a process story since it s infotainment on arnold schwarzenegger s tonight show surprise trivial pursuits about todaywith the ratification of the treaty of guadalupe hidalgo in the mexican american war ended the u s picked up california utah and nevada and some states to be named later in the deal yesterday s triviajim swift of the weekly standard was the first to correctly respond that sen roy blunt r mo has served in both the house and senate republican leadership today s triviacourtesy of jim which former nfl quarterback designed the house s electronic vote scoreboard send answers to trivia sidewire com the first person to respond correctly gets to ask tomorrow s trivia question what to do with news tips suggestions amp correctionssend them to jon sidewire com saving the senate republicans try to find the right message paul kane made the most of sen pat roberts th birthday celebration to draw parallels between the campaign â when senate republicans scrambled to save their majority as their former leader bob dole headed for certain defeat at the top of the ticket â and the election why so clever the top republicans from â dole then sen majority leader trent lott and then house speaker newt gingrich â were in attendance for roberts big day lott s strategy back then was to present the senate as productive on the legislative front and as an independent check on president bill clinton a posture that suggested dole would lose what i wanted to do was save the senate now senate majority whip john cornyn r texas says there will be a reprise of the independent check argument but he s not handing the election to clinton in his framing â if i were running in i would be running as a check on the president certainly on a president clinton but i think even president trump obviously heâ s not what iâ d call a traditional republican â bernie going for broke patrick healy yamiche alcindor amp jeremy w peters report for the new york times that bernie sanders advisers say he is fully committed to winning the nomination by any political means necessary that has infuriated hillary clinton supporters who think that his aggressiveness at a time when he is all but assured of losing the nomination could hurt the party s chances in november and they are particularly upset by reports of his sanders supporters threatening democratic officials who back clinton or are perceived as unfair to sanders bernie and i have known each other for a long time and i believe he is better than this sidewire chat recap minneapolis mayor betsy hodges first and foremost rip prince can you share with us what it s been like in minneapolis and for you with his death the community is still mourning we were of him and he was of us a lot of it has been beautiful celebrations of him and his work we loved him and love him still on her state of the city address on pope photos you traveled with a few other us mayors to meet the pope dramatic pause that is amazing highlights of the trip highlights were having an audience with the pope of course he pulled us mayors together about climate change and human trafficking it s surreal to have photos of the pope on your phone that you took yourself did the meeting with pope go well are you pals now he seems like he d be good at texting pope francis looks just like himself in person and he spoke to us for some time about how important mayors are in addressing climate change he said it would have to happen from the periphery to the center on clinton s running mate there have been rumors that hillary might look at our sen al franken as her veep care to comment on that choice or any other perhaps she should choose a mayor i heard that mayors are the new governors al franken is amazing and v good at his job i d hate to lose him but i understand why she would want him i hear she might look at former mayors and that would be great too on hillary clinton amp wonder woman last question and we ll let you go you re a wonder woman memorabilia collector what item s would you loan to hillary for the coming months she s already got the bullet deflecting cuffs so i would give her the lasso of truth maybe a frequent flyer pass to paradise island so she could get a boost from the sisterhood whenever she wanted pretty sure journalists could use that as well after she uses it on them sidewire chat ed rendell former pennsylvania gov ed rendell co founder of building america s future chatted about the nation s infrastructure on sidewire yesterday in conjunction with infrastructure week here s a bit of what he had to say on the challenges of getting buy in everyone in congress knows we need to invest in our infrastructure because it is literally falling apart and causing us to lose economic competitiveness in the global marketplace but no one wants to bite the bullet and take the risk of increasing the funding everyone wants to go to heaven but no one wants to go to hell on the campaign s implications for infrastructure needs the good news however is that all three candidates clinton trump and sanders â have said that long term infrastructure revitalization is a key issue for them and all three understand it s the best way to create millions of well and they also recognize that it s a key to revitalizing american manufacturing how do you feel about a mexican border wall as an infrastructure project it may not be the dumbest idea i ve ever heard but it s awfully close on the top infrastructure priorities people generally seem to focus on transportation infrastructure and there are pressing needs there but the immediate need exists in almost every facet of our infrastructure â water and sewer lines pipelines the build out of the electrical grid broadband access dams ports etcetera etcetera is trump vulnerable to attacks on his business acumen or does the public s association of him with wealth over the years make that an impossible narrative to undermine have feedback for us email team sidewire com mailto team sidewire com sidewire inc battery streetsuite san francisco ca usa

sub: RE: COMMS Review: Trumpâ€™s Tax Plan Remains Reckless and Dangerous
body: goodâ democratic national committeesome editsimportance highsl trumpâ s tax plan remains reckless and dangerousâ look past the spin and political double speak and itâ s easy to see that donald trumpâ s tax plan remains the is the same failed idea peddled by and even more reckless than what was proposed paul ryan and republicans in congress â just more reckless trumpâ s tax plan is built on the same failed foundation of rewards those at the top by slashing the top income tax rate which that would give the top of income earners like himself an average tax cut of more than million itâ s clear that when trump wins hard working families inevitably lose â

team as promised attached are some templates materials for national infrastructure week including an advisory release op ed and letters to the editor if you have any questions please contact your dnc regional press secretary northeast shu yen wei weis dnc org south deshundra jefferson jeffersond dnc org midwest tj helmstetter helmstettert dnc org west walter garcia garciaw dnc org thanks tj helmstetterdeputy director of regional amp specialty mediademocratic national committee cell deskhelmstettert dnc orgdate friday may at pmhey folks thanks very much to the state parties who held press conferences or otherwise achieved media hits using the trump ryan meeting hook we want to encourage more of these events moving forward to be clear the hook can and should be localized as much as possible so you can adjust our templating to make it relevant to your markets on monday weâ ll be sending out some messaging related to national infrastructure week and weâ ll be asking you to think about how you can use that hook to put on pressers and achieve tv and print hits in your markets on friday of next week the nra is having its leadership forum with trump rubio mcconnell ryan and others hope you can start thinking about those two hooks over the weekend for events next week here are a few of the great clips weâ ve seen from events this week dayton congressman turner says heâ ll support donald trumpkcci des moines local mark tauscheckwispolitics comdes moines register iowa democratic party chair andy mcguireiowa daily democrat mike gloverhey everyone â tomorrow donald trump is coming to washington d c to meet with paul ryan reince priebus and mitch mcconnell the ryan meeting is the highlight because ryan has withheld his endorsement of trump thus far this is an ideal opportunity to highlight the historic mess that is the republican party with the speaker of the house of representatives not ready to fully endorse his partyâ s nominee and a slew of former gop presidential candidates former republican presidents and vulnerable senate and house candidates trying to distance themselves from their standard bearer weâ re asking state party communications directors to put together events around thursday morningâ s trump ryan meeting to deliver the message that while trump and ryan may have a personal disagreement they are both pushing the same divisive and dangerous agenda weâ re also asking state party communications directors to echo these events with op eds and letters to the editor in local papers and surrogates on television and radio attached please find a packet with materials to put together an event in this packet youâ ll find â sample talking points message guidanceâ a sample advisoryâ a sample press releaseâ a sample op edâ four sample letters to the editordnc can offer national surrogates to appear via satellite or phone on local television and radio broadcasts to amplify the message please reach out to walker dnc org lt mailto walker dnc org gt if you would like to book one of our surrogates members of congress and senators who are currently in washington can also use our studio to do local hits hereâ s what weâ re looking for in terms of event logistics â types of speakers o state party chairs vice chairs and edso local elected officialso allied groups â planned parenthood naacp mi familia vota etc o laboro people sharing personal storiesâ about supportersâ signs that say â reject the trump ryan agendaâ â we have a mockup that can be found here lt trump ryan sign pdf gt â a big push to get local tv to the event â studies show that local tv is the dominant player in most markets and americans trust local tv news about points more than they trust national tv news the republican party has elevated offensive policies and extreme voices using divisive campaigns for years and now theyâ re stuck with donald trumpâ s reckless and dangerous campaign heading into the general election we have to make sure we hold republicans in congress and in every state accountable for their partyâ s dysfunction as they chaotically tumble toward the general election and while republicans argue democratic voters are overwhelming in agreement that our primary has been exciting and large majorities would support either one of our candidates eric walkerwalkere dnc org lt mailto walkere dnc org gt you received sub: FW: DNC Talking Points on the Cruz / Fiorina Ticket
body: dnc talking points on the ted cruz carly fiorina ticket this is a desperate attempt by a desperate campaign to change the narrative after netting only a single delegate in last night s contests by selecting a vp candidate when he is less than halfway to the nomination ted cruz is even more delusional than john kasich who has only won his home state and marco rubio who gave a victory speech after a third place finish in iowa it s fitting that senator cruz best known for shutting down the u s government would select carly fiorina as his vp best known for almost shutting down a great u s company as ceo of hewlett packard carly fiorina o cut hp s stock value in half don t be fooled cruz and fiorina are not outsiders cruz has been in politics for decades and has collected a government paycheck since and fiorina is only an outsider because california voters overwhelmingly rejected her candidacy even in a banner year for republicans here s what some others have had to say about fiorina s disastrous tenure at hp mark paustenbachnational press secretary amp deputy communications directordemocratic national committeew paustenbachm dnc org lt mailto paustenbachm dnc org gt

sub: Donald Trump In 1992: Tyson Told Me Victim In Rape Case â€œWanted It Real Badâ€
body: per our convo this morningâ she knocked on his door at a m and was up and dancing at eight the next morning â posted on apr at p m donald trumpâ s rivals ted cruz and carly fiorina have hammered the frontrunner this week for touting the endorsement of former heavyweight boxing champion mike tyson in indiana â a state where tyson was convicted in of raping a beauty pageant contestant desiree washington in another instance in late trump discussed the case at length in an interview with charlie rose the topic centered around a new york magazine profile in which trump said his mother was angry at him for defending tyson in the piece trump said tyson told him the victim â wanted it real bad â donald is discussing his buddy mike tyson tyson told trump the woman who put him in jail â wanted it real bad â trump feels tyson is doing time on a bad rap â she knocked on his door at a m and was up and dancing at eight the next morning â this speech is another of the set pieces he is so fond of delivering when he defended tyson and suggested a payoff and community service for the champ his mother got so angry she raised her voice to him for the first time in his years trump said his mother was not amused with his defense of tyson â i think thatâ s probably the first time that my mother absolutely got angry at me â trump told rose â i really mean that my mother was so crazy when i came out in defense of mike tyson â again remarking that his mother was livid at him trump added that he had problems with how tysonâ s defense was handled â she didnâ t exactly like the fact that i was defending iron mike but i watched what happened to mike tyson â said trump â i watched how badly he was represented by an attorney in washington that was charging him or million against a local attorney the best within miles that the state hired who just ate the other manâ s lunch i watched the way he did it â trump then questioned if the rape even had occurred suggesting the victim made it up â i heard about a girl that late in the evening knocked on his door was taken in was raped perhaps perhaps not â said trump â i donâ t know again i think he was badly represented but i did see that number one she knocks late in the night number two sheâ s dancing in a beauty contest at a m i saw the tapes i see the big smile on her face sheâ s dancing happily at a m then mike tysonâ s in jail for four five or six years i had a real problem with that case i had a real problem with mike tysonâ s lawyers i had a real problem with don king i just think that he was really fed out to the wolves â trump noted tyson still denied the charges and said he believed if tyson hadnâ t testified would have been found not guilty â he to this day denies it â said trump when asked by rose if tyson should have gone to jail if found guilty â i donâ t know that it happened i think that as they said if he didnâ t testify he would have been exonerated totally the jury said that mike was arrogant he was a horrible witness from what i understand iâ m not surprised i would say that generally speaking you donâ t put mike on as a witness but he was a horrible witness to get four five or six years i think that there was just too many circumstances again she was in a beauty contest she was dancing with a big smile on her face at a m â trump said tyson was thrown in jail before being found guilty and deserved another chance â i watched mike â he staid â iâ ve been with mike iâ ve seen him people really take advantage of this man i want to tell you something i think this is one of those examples now i know we have a system of juries we have a system where if youâ re found guilty youâ re guilty but somebody like me and maybe who has a little bit more independent streak can say â hey mike tyson in my opinion should really be given another break â they put him in jail before he was even guilty as far as i was concerned â eric walkerwalkere dnc org lt mailto walkere dnc org gt

body: ok about to hit send on this thanks rachel palermodemocratic national committeepalermor dnc org lt mailto palermor dnc org gt one grammar fix in the last sentence and i m goldgreatone tweak framing in last sentence so that we don t dismiss trump outright but rather raise the gop s divisive politics and instead of getting million people health care making it accessible i ll blast this out rachel palermodemocratic national committeepalermor dnc org lt mailto palermor dnc org gt cool some suggested edits below eric drafted this last nightsl is thin skinned trump s prez run an attempt at payback for white house correspondents dinner that evening of public abasement rather than sending mr trump away accelerated his ferocious efforts to gain stature within the political world and it captured the degree to which mr trump s campaign is driven by a deep yearning sometimes obscured by his bluster and bragging a desire to be taken seriously so in addition to rescuing the u s economy rescuing and the auto industry creating over million new jobs getting unemployment to under getting making providing health coverage accessible to million previously uninsured americans while slowing the growth of health costs killing osama bin laden and taking out key isis leaders other terrorists president obama may have forced the republican party to own the results of years of their ugly and divisive politics a democratic successor and he did it using nothing but his comedic chops thanks obama

thatâ s it it took him six years to come up with a policy invented in the s if you were hoping republicans had fresh new solutions for health care reform up their sleeves you might find the recent hints from house speaker paul ryan r wis a bit disappointing after six years of the gop failing to come up with a comprehensive alternative to the affordable care act what ryan outlined during an appearance at georgetown university on wednesday was essentially another stab at a decades old idea thatâ s never really worked â an idea that would involve allowing health insurance companies to resume charging sick people higher rates than healthy people the cornerstone of ryanâ s approach is so called high risk pools a form of health insurance designed for people with the most serious health conditions and highest costs who were mostly locked out of the regular private market before the affordable care act required insurers to accept all applicants if the concept sounds familiar itâ s because high risk pools have existed since and are a go to policy proposal for republicans who donâ t want to be accused of not caring about people with pre existing conditionsâ the problem is high risk pools â which existed in states before the affordable care act made them virtually obsolete â always failed to achieve their goal of providing a true insurer of last resort to those who needed itâ â this was part of ryanâ s argument to the college aged audience that letting insurance companies once again discriminate against the sick and moving the most ailing into a separate program would be good for them young people would pay lower health insurance premiums if older sicker people were in a separate program he said but that doesnâ t account for the cost to taxpayers of whatever government subsidies would be provided to people in the high risk poolsâ earlier in his appearance at georgetown ryan repeated his promise that republicans would finally tell americans how they would do health care reform differentlyâ ryan didnâ t offer a lot of fine detail in his four minute reply to the studentâ s question republicans will supposedly unveil a health care plan this summer and maybe it will address the shortcomings apparent in what ryan did say this week for now though his plan sounds like it wonâ t be as good for people with pre existing conditions as what they already sub: RE: Video Request: HRC in Athens, OH
body: â talks about importance of coal country in th centuryâ i wonâ t make promises i canâ t keepâ i know you may find it hard to vote for any democrat or me particular but iâ m going to keep tryingâ the best years can still be ahead of us but itâ s going to require people being inspired by spirit to not only complain about problems but roll up our sleeves and solve themâ our energy sector is changing dramatically we have to invest in coal country bring new jobs stand up to coal executives trying to shirk responsibilities to workers and retireesâ no matter what some politicians tell you these trends are here to stay weâ re not going to go back to an energy system that looks like th century we need to fight climate change and accelerate transition to clean energy economyâ but anyone who says we can flip a switch and be there tomorrow isnâ t being honest with you tomorrowâ hits don blankenship who protested her yesterdayâ with trumpâ s tax cuts to billionaires we could make social security and medicare solvent for the next yearsâ closing the epa is not the answer to rebuilding a region as we transition to clean renewable energyâ closing dept of education wonâ t stop china from dumping steel or keep schools open being introduced now on abc go

sub: For Ken Vogel re joint fundraising story
body: look good on the record the dnc offered to engage in the same joint fundraising efforts with all the major presidential candidates early in the cycle and we welcome the efforts of the candidates to help raise money for the dnc and state parties now to ensure we can build out the infrastructure to win in november background the funds raised help with critical investments in infrastructure maintaining the dncâ s national voter file and bolstering our research communications and digital capabilities all of which will help elect democrats up and down the ballot in november and strengthen state parties across the country you can find some of our efforts in the overview of our democratic victory task force report that came out in november mark paustenbachnational press secretary amp deputy communications directordemocratic national committee paustenbachm dnc org
